Topic.Title: A 'How to Play' section on the main site?

Posts.EditableText:
I haven't even been on this site very long and I've already seen several people trying to play games and leaving confused or incredulous remarks because they literally [i:jwrtqd1q]have no idea what IF is[/i:jwrtqd1q] and not even the foggiest idea of how to play. It's so far outside their experience that even with the 'type here' prompt, typing commands (even 'help') is something that would never occur to them, and invariably they blame the game itself. 

Is there any way we could get an explanation of the basics somewhere on the main site that we can link these people too? Something added to the Help section maybe?

Well I'm not sure how usable any of this is, but here's a rough draft I hacked out:  

*******

[b:2s82jqad]Help! How do I play?[/b:2s82jqad]

There are two different kinds of text adventures hosted here on the site: gamebooks and interactive fiction.

Gamebooks can be written in many styles but most of them can be thought of like the choose-you-own-adventure books you might have enjoyed as a child. You begin reading a story and are asked to make decisions that allow you to follow it along branching paths, with different choices leading to different outcomes.

Interactive fiction puts you in charge of a character you control using typed commands to explore their simulated world. You can [b:2s82jqad]look[/b:2s82jqad] at your surroundings or specific objects there, move from room to room using compass directions like [b:2s82jqad]north[/b:2s82jqad], [b:2s82jqad]south[/b:2s82jqad], [b:2s82jqad]east[/b:2s82jqad], and [b:2s82jqad]west[/b:2s82jqad], [b:2s82jqad]take[/b:2s82jqad] or [b:2s82jqad]get[/b:2s82jqad] items which will then be placed in your [b:2s82jqad]inventory[/b:2s82jqad]. (For convenience you may use abbreviations such as [b:2s82jqad]l[/b:2s82jqad] or [b:2s82jqad]x[/b:2s82jqad] for 'l'ook or e'x'amine, [b:2s82jqad]n, s, e, w[/b:2s82jqad] to travel, or '[b:2s82jqad]i[/b:2s82jqad]' to examine the items in your inventory.) 

In most games you solve puzzles or progress through the plot by using actions or 'verbs' to interact with your surroundings. You might [b:2s82jqad]use[/b:2s82jqad] one object on another, [b:2s82jqad]push[/b:2s82jqad] a button or [b:2s82jqad]pull[/b:2s82jqad] a lever, [b:2s82jqad]unlock[/b:2s82jqad] a door with a key, [b:2s82jqad]speak to[/b:2s82jqad] a knight or [b:2s82jqad]kill[/b:2s82jqad] a troll with a sword. Every game is different and limited only by the imagination of the author and player. 

*******

If anyone wants to expand on anything go right ahead. The gamebook section in particular is pretty sparse, but I wasn't sure how much detailed explanation 'click the links' really needed...
